perturbation.changed_text: Arbitration. Except as otherwise specified below, all actions, disputes, claims and controversies under common law, statutory law or in equity of any type or nature whatsoever, whether arising before or after the date of this Agreement, and whether directly or indirectly Page 9 of 10 relating to: (a) this Agreement and/or any amendments and addenda hereto, or the breach, invalidity or termination hereof; (b) any previous or subsequent agreement between the parties; and/or (c) any other relationship, transaction or dealing between the parties (collectively the "Disputes"), will be subject to non-binding arbitration pursuant to the Arbitration Rules of U.S. Arbitration & Mediation, (www.usam.com). perturbation.explanation: Changed the binding arbitration to non-binding arbitration. By changing the arbitration to be non-binding, the company introduces a contradiction because non-binding arbitration may not be enforceable under certain state statutes. Also, making the award appealable makes the process take longer and cost more money.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Arbitration Act, state arbitration statutes (e.g., Arizona Revised Statutes Title 12, Chapter 9).

If neither party has a substantial connection to California, a court might question the choice of law, potentially leading to litigation over which state's laws apply. This creates uncertainty and could impact enforceability, especially if California law differs significantly from Arizona law on relevant issues.
